item.description:
It is the board game version of the popular tv show "Still Standing".
In this game every player can win! Answer correctly to the quiz, and you can keep your chance for the "money". Because if you are wrong other player wins.
All of the 10 characters will play until he/she "falls down".

In Draftica, each player is a Celtic chieftain assembling a tribe of 18 cards. Combinations of cards score points, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Players do this by collecting (or "drafting") both common cards in the colours red, green, blue and yellow, and rarer special cards that can provide a substantial reward for specialising in certain types of card.

Unlike some other drafting games, there is no lengthy playout phase to determine a winner - the game takes place entirely in the drafting phase itself, with many opportunities to outwit and outmanoeuvre your rivals. May the best drafter win!

New version of Alias which challenges players to a rap battle! Two teams go against each other and try to beat each other with the power of words. Alongside with traditional Alias, Rähinä Alias also includes a Battle phase where players attempt to figure out rhymes from the given words.

item.description:
The players must find the ghosts in the forest, by catching them in headlights of their cars.

The game is played on a five by five grid of tiles. Players taking turns moving their car on the grid, turning their headlights on after each move. This allows them to flip over the tiles in a straight line in front of the car - until they reach a ghost, or the end of the board.

The player that finds the most ghosts wins the game.

The object of Orator is to deliver the best orations on a variety of topics without making any blunders within a two minute time limit. Players attempt to avoid blunders commonly made in spoken English today, such as, 'umm', 'aah', 'err' etc.

Players may resort to bluffing to complete their talk however successful detection of bluffing and making of blunders incurs penalties. The player who is given the highest score by the other players (the audience) wins the round. The winner of Orator is the player with the best overall score for the game.

In Zany Penguins, you want to make sure that your tribe of penguins is the one that takes control of the Earth, so do what you can to take charge of regions such as the desert, jungle, and the North Pole.

In game terms, each region has a set of cards numbered 1-9. To set up, shuffle the deck, then deal each player a personal deck of 18 cards. Each player starts with two cards in hand.

On a turn, you draw two cards, pass one card each to your left- and right-hand neighbors, take the cards passed to you, then simultaneously play and reveal one card in front of you on the table. If you play a 1, on your next turn you play and reveal two cards instead of one; if you play a 2, it blows up all 6-9 cards played that same turn; and if you play a 3, on the subsequent turn everyone else plays before you do.

After eight turns, for each card color on the table in front of you in which you have the highest sum of all players, you score the sum of all cards of this color in your hand. For each color in which you don't have the highest sum, you score the single lowest card of this color in your hand. Players tally their scores, and whoever has the most points wins.

item.description:
From the publisher's website:
Have you ever found yourself...

Not knowing what you're doing at the gym
Being too drunk at a wedding
Farting in yoga class

Just Four Kicks is a hilarious party game where anything can happen through creativity, quick thinking, and general debauchery. Watch your friends try to act out “being too drunk at a wedding” or use someone else’s body to depict “farting in yoga class.” Bring it to your next game night and it'll be guaranteed to bring your friends together through countless laughs and just a touch of embarrassment.

from the back of the box:
Do you like fun? Do you enjoy laughing? Are you interested in having an all around good time? If you answered yes to any of these questions (hopefully all) grab a copy of Just Four Kicks and prepare to have the time of your life. Inside jokes included in the box.

Now I'm sure you're thinking, wow, this game sounds amazing, how is it played? Start by finding at least three friends (or strangers) and splitting into two equal teams. Just Four Kicks has four rounds of play that will get progressively more intense and hilarious, so choose your teammates wisely. Each player has 30 seconds to get their team to guess as many cards as possible by describing the topic, doing charades, or using someone else's body as a puppet. The team that guesses the most cards wins!

Close Counts is the party game where the best guesstimate wins! How many Coco-Cola products are sold every day? What did the world's most expensive painting cost? How many DeLorean sports cars were manufactured? How many pennies would it take to circle the world? Don't know!?!? It doesn't matter!!! You don't need to know the answer, you just have to be closer than everyone else - now that's what counts! There are six categories of statistical fun: Time Traveller, Numbers and Nature, Dollars and Cents, Records and Feats, What Year Was That? and No Way! New 2015

From the publisher:

Thrones is a two-player 9x9 board game where each players set their tiles and pieces secretly, screened from their opponent's view, until the screen is removed, the middle fifth row is set, and the battle's combat begins. The object of the game is kill their opponent's King; alternatively, a player may win by occupying his opponent's Fortress with his own King.

Each player controls 15 pieces at the beginning of the game:

 2 Spearmen (infantry)
 2 Rangers (infantry)
 2 Crossbows (ranged)
 1 Catapult (ranged)
 1 Trebuchet (ranged)
 2 Lancers (cavalry)
 1 Warhorse (cavalry)
 2 Elephants (cavalry)
 1 King (infantry)
 1 Dragon




In addition each player gets 36 tiles for building the playing Surface:

 14 Plains
 9 Forest
 6 Water
 6 Mountains
 1 Fortress

Cooperative tile laying game for children.

Build a path through the kingdom but watch out for those pesky dragons!

Includes game board, number and letter dice, 21 Path tiles, 16 Dragon tiles, and 3 Knights Gear tiles.

One at a time, face-down tiles are drawn from a stack. Path tiles may placed on the board as desired. Dragon tiles are placed according to the grid position dictated by two dice. Dragons much be avoided, but can be fought off with Knight's Gear once collected.

name.value: You & Me: a game of love and intimacy

item.description:
A fun game for lovers promising exciting encounters and romantic inspirations. With 90 innovative ideas, sexy suggestions and adventurous activities, You & Me is a game where the taking part really is almost as good as winning!

Roll the dice to see who will enjoy the intimate attentions of their lover as they perform one of the many passionate pleasures prescribed by the cards.
The player performing the action is the one who receives the points. 
The winner is the first player to reach 30 points.

In this game based on the animated series players attempt to collect since, toxins, viruses, and bacteria matching the colors on their player board. During their turn a player spins a spinner and takes the corresponding color of standee.

name.value: Cluedo: Doctor Who – The Hunt for Gallifrey

item.description:
The Doctor may have defeated Missy and stopped the Cyberman army released from the Nethersphere, but his old friend continues playing her twisted games, toying with the Doctor’s mind. In her final moments, she reveals that she knows a secret he cannot resist…the location of Gallifrey.

But the coordinates she gives him just lead to empty space and in Cluedo: The Hunt for Gallifrey, you play the part of the Doctor, visiting nine recent locations, with six inventions to meet six recent enemies and uncover the true coordinates of your lost home.

Simple roll and move game. The first player to reach space 60 on exact count wins the game. The red numbered spaces represent events from the fairy tale that hinder or benefit the players.

The game was most likely produced between 1918 and 1922, since it doesn't show the "ABC Verlag" imprint.

It was also part of at least one game compilation.

Work together with your friends and family to put the crooks behind bars!

Play as detectives and walk around the city hunting for clues and completing tasks. The Chief Detective has given you a 24 h deadline to solve the crime, make sure you complete your investigation by then or the robbers go free! Teamwork will get you to the bottom of each case.

Unforeseen events may hinder your progress, though....

In this game you move around the board taking your tiles to the required locations to collect evidence. Each turn before you move you draw a WePhone tile, and these might help or hinder your progress (give you extra movement, shut various buildings, or return tiles you've already collected to collect again). You are cooperatively trying to collect all the 12 evidence tiles before the game ends (24 turns, represented by the WePhone deck).

Each Anno Domini game consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other. Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr contains historical events related to voyages of famous people, transport, traffic motorization, etc. Like all Anno Domini sets, this game can be played as a standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

In Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr, each player receives nine cards (or fewer, if you want the game to be shorter) and may look only at the descriptions. In turn, players place a card on the table, trying to place their card in chronological order to those already present. Instead of adding a card, a player may claim that the order in which the cards have been placed is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.

If the order is correct, then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order is incorrect, then the previous player – who accepted the order as correct or made it incorrect through her own placement – receives three cards. The first player with no cards remaining in hand wins.

A fully cooperative survival miniatures board game. Mission-based with a highly modular game board.

Every player takes the roll of a survivor to fight against bad hunters and mutants, causes through the outbreak 5 years ago.

Red Fall offers a great combat system where positioning is the key to survive. You have to find Items, weapons, crafting upgrades with components to manage your character. You can learn skills to improve your chances to survive.

Beside the combat system one of the great and innovative game features is the enemy AI. Every enemy acts by itself. They have movement paths and smart combat mechanics.

In the survival game turned on its undead head Dead By Night, you are part of the legions that now hunt and stalk the remnants of humanity that survive in this shattered and ruined city. Each day still weakens you, and some mortals even attempt to hunt you down as you race against rival beings who are seeking the power to rule the night itself.

Hand management and consistent player interaction make this a fun and casual, yet deceptively strategic risk vs reward-style game.

Team Yankee is a tabletop miniatures wargame that is set in a fictional World War III in 1985 based on the novel of the same name by Harold Coyle.

The game is a standard two player miniature wargame with each player taking command of a company or battalion level force consisting of hand painted miniatures. The game provides one 6 different missions for the purpose of pickup games. There are also several scenarios in the book that allow the players to recreate some of the battles from the Team Yankee novel.

The game has an accompanying line of 15mm scale miniatures to use but it can be played with models from any manufacture.

The Game releases with 4 army lists that players may choose from, A United States tank Company, A United states Mechanized Infantry company, A Soviet Tank Battalion, and a Soviet Mechanized Infantry Battalion.

link.value: Team Yankee: Bannon's Boys – American Spearhead Force
Team Yankee: Charlie's Chieftains – British Armored Squadron
Team Yankee: Leopard – West Germans in World War III
Team Yankee: Potecknov's Bears – Soviet Breakthrough Force
Team Yankee: Stripes – US Forces in World War III
Team Yankee: Volksarmee – East Germans in World War III
Team Yankee: Hammerfall – World War III Battles
Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

item.description: Typical spin and move game. The first player, who cross all the route, wins the game.

This cardgame plays a lot like "Werewolves of Miller's Hollow", but with a twist.

The settings is the wild west, in a town called Tombstone. Two outlaws and a wannabe outlaw are hidden amongst the cowboys, and each night they kill an innocent cowboy. Their goal is to bring down the number of cowboys untill they outnumber them. But each morning the cowboys gather and hang someone, hoping to eliminate the outlaws.

Each player is secretly assigned a role : you may be the sheriff, the barber, the doctor, the priest or the hero. You can hide this identity, but if you want to use your special ability (like healing a shot person if you are the doctor, of taking the confession of another player if you are the priest) then you need to reveal your card. Of course, this is a risk if the outlaws consider you dangerous.

Unlike the werewolves, the outlaws can have a special character too. The priest, or even the hero, can be an outlaw. This makes the paranoia even bigger: when the cowboys decide to hang a person, why does the judge decide to let him free? Why doesn't the doctor heal the priest after being shot? This make the game much more intriguing. No more "hey i'm a special character i'm innocent"...

Another difference is that you can play the game with lesser persons. There are rules to play the game with up to 25 players, but slightly different rules to make it playable with 13-24 players, 4-12 players, and even 2-3 players. In the case of 4-12 players each player has more than one character, which means you are not eliminated out of the game as soon as one character dies.

A card game to exerce memory. Each player in turn plays a card and either says the specified word or acts according to the specified action. The game continues until someone makes a mistake and forget the words or actions on hidden cards. Whoever has the highest number of cards wins!

Un jeu de cartes pour faire travailler sa mémoire. Chacun à son tour pose une carte et dit le mot ou fait le geste indiqué. Le jeu continue jusqu’à ce que quelqu’un se trompe et oublie les mots ou les actions des cartes cachées. Celui qui a le plus grand nombre d’« avions à réaction » gagne la partie !

From the publisher (translated):
In this game, the two faces of the cards are useful and each has a different animal. To win, nothing more simple: Get a hand of cards of the same animal. But be careful because each card played imposes an action that could work against you!

From the publisher:
Dans ce jeu, les 2 faces des cartes sont utiles et chacune comporte un animal différent. Pour gagner, rien de plus simple : Obtenir dans sa main des cartes d'un même animal. Mais attention car chaque carte jouée impose une action qui pourrait se retourner contre vous !

item.description:
Star Wars: Star Battle takes the player to the very heart of conflict between Empire and Rebellion. At every move you must make decisions that will determine the fate of the squads you command. Your pilots must face attacks from the enemy's TIE fighters Star Destroyers and and even Lord Vader's advanced TIE fighter. How many men will you risk on a particular course of action?

A game for 2-4 players where you take a role as a You are the Leader of the elite group of six rebellion squads attempting to be the first to reach the "Objective Line- destroy the Death Star". Your task is to get through 3 enemy lines while trying to limit your casualties. It's a "push your luck" game where you roll dice and play cards matching the roll, after which you can decide to try to advance further, or stop and carry out card actions. Pushing too far could incur heavy losses.

item.description:
The Queen has called on her fearless knights to help unite the kingdom. In this cooperative game, players must build a safe path across the green fields of Dragonwood while dashing past diving dragons! Will you make it before you run out of resources? Or will the dragons be victorious?

In Dragon Dash, players take turns drawing tiles and placing paths to connect both sides of the board and randomly placing dragon tiles with the roll of the dice. Players must connect both sides of the board with one continuous path to win. If the dragons block the path so that it cannot connect, the game is lost. Along the way, players may collect knight's gear (shield, helmet and sword) which may be used to defeat dragons who may attempt to destroy their paths.

From the box:

Taking place against the backdrop of the brutal Sanctus Reach campaign, Stormclaw pits the Space Wolves of Krom Dragongaze against the Orks of the barbaric Warboss Grukk Face-rippa. Inside this box you will find a fantastic collection of Citadel miniatures representing the key warriors of this conflict. In addition, there is a narrative book and a compact version of the Warhammer 40,000 rules, allowing you to read about and reenact the pivotal battles.

ENGLISH
Starfleet Legions is a card game for 1-4 players which takes us to a science fiction universe where humanity is threatened by the alien Insectoids: A highly hostile race intended to end our specie. You'll be in command of a infantry squad, traveling through the galaxy and eliminating the threat. Starfleet Legions is a competitive game. The squadron with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins. You'll need get the most from your 4 soldiers, equip them with the best possible weapons and use cunning tactics.

During combats, each player will be drawing and allocating result cards for the members of their squads, trying to maximize casualties and considering their strengths and advantages. All the result decks have the same proportion of cards: critical success (1), success (2), partial success (3), partial failure (1), failure (2) and fumble (1). When a card is assigned to a soldier, it can no longer be changed during that round of combat. All results are evaluated at the end of the round depending on the skills and equipment of each soldier in the squad. Requiring enemies are eliminated before those who has survived attack the squad members.

ESPAÑOL:
Starfleet Legions (Las Legiones del Espacio), es un juego de cartas de 1 a 4 jugadores, que nos traslada a un universo de ciencia ficción en el que la Humanidad se encuentra amenazada por los Insectoides alienígenas: Una raza altamente hostil, que pretende acabar con nuestra especie. Estarás al mando de una Escuadra de infantería de Las Legiones del Espacio, encargada de viajar a lo largo de la galaxia, eliminando a la amenaza Insectoide allí donde se encuentre. Starfleet Legions es un juego competitivo, en el que la Escuadra con mayor cantidad de Puntos de Victoria resultará vencedora al final de la partida. Deberás sacar el máximo partido posible a tus cuatro Soldados, equiparlos con las mejores armas posibles y utilizar sus tácticas con astucia.

Durante los combates, cada jugador extrae y asigna cartas de resultado para los miembros de su escuadra, tratando de maximizar las bajas y teniendo en cuenta sus fortalezas y ventajas. Todos los mazos de resultados tienen la misma proporción: crítico (1), éxito (2), éxito parcial (3), fallo parcial (1), fallo (2) y pifia (1). Cuando se asigna una carta a un soldado, ya no se puede cambiar durante ese asalto de combate. Todos los resultados son evaluados al final de la ronda en función de las habilidades y equipo de cada soldado en la escuadra. Los enemigos que se requieran son eliminados antes de que, los que ha sobrevivido ataquen a los miembros de la escuadra.

item.description:
Orig. - "Fahrt ins Mühltal", eng. - "The trip to Muhltal (a municipality in the district of Darmstadt-Dieburg, in Hesse, Germany)". 
The game consists of a board with holes in. Each hole scores a certain number of points. At the back of the board, a three-dimensional 'slides' is erected. Into the top of these slides, a player in his turn, drops a ball. The ball will bounce around the 3 separated slides and come out at the bottom and score points when it settles into one of the holes.

The points available range from 1 to 10.

The one who earns the most points, wins.

Path Finder is an education game designed to help teach measuring and comparisons of length and area, along with logic and reasoning.

To play the game, players take turns rolling a die and placing a piece of the corresponding color (if able) in the carved wooden path.

In the Level 1 variant the goal is simply to fill up the path.
In the Level 2 variant, each player gets an equal number of pieces and tries to be the first to place them all.

Psychomachia is a strategic card game in which you collect and command the seven deadly sins and seven heavenly virtues.

Each turn, players throw tokens that determine the quantity of virtuous and sinful actions that they will be able to perform. With these actions, players can place cards on the table, move cards to heaven, earth and hell, and summon the powers of the virtues and sins on their table and in their hand.

The goal of Psychomachia is to be the first person to place all seven virtues in heaven or all seven sins in hell, using any permitted combination of the four types of cards found in the game: Sin\Virtue cards, Heavenly Virtue cards, Deadly Sin cards, and Fate wildcards. Along the way, you can use the special powers of the virtues and sins in your possession to complete your collection first, or prevent other players from completing theirs.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
History of Civilizations is a card-driven civilization game for 3 to 8 players that depict the rise and fall of empires from 4000BCE to 1900CE. Each player leads his empires to Glory through conquest, trade, science, religion, wealth, culture and many other means. The player with most Glory at the end of the game is the winner.

History of Civilizations differs from most other civilization board games as each player controls several civilizations at once. The game is divided into 5 Ages and takes place on a map spanning the entire world. Each round, players will take turns playing cards from their hand to build cities and wonders, move units, adopt religions, gain powerful leaders, trade with other empires, produce new units and many other things. Each card also depicts an empire that can be started if the game has reached a certain age and an event. Events can be played to affect the game in many ways; everything from natural disasters, generals, spies, revolts, golden ages and usurpers is included in the game.

Each empire has an individual set of Glory conditions that define what that particular empire must achieve in order to earn Glory points (victory points). For example, the Mongols want to be the largest empire in the world and conquer other empires, whereas England wants to have the most colonies and the largest navy. At the end of each round, all empires in play gain Glory according to their empire card. If an empire is performing poorly, it can simply be discarded to free up that empire slot, allowing you to play another empire later. This way, new and more modern empires keep coming into play as the game progresses.

History of Civilizations has many small and simple parts that make up a complex and highly dynamical game, where no two games will play out the same way. Imagine western history without the Romans and Greeks. What if the Aztecs and Incas held out against the Spanish conquistadors? What would the world look like if you made all the decisions?

Ta bouche is a card game from 1 to 5 players.

Includes: 110 cards (50 'Thoughts' cards, 50 'Retort' cards, 10 scoring cards), 1 dice.

Each player draws a card. One of the players read out loud one of the Thoughts lines: the other players, each at their turn, must use one of their 'Retort' lines to snap back the silliest or funnniest retort.

The player who fails to do that, or gives the lamest retort (after a decision by the reader), is shouted out: "Ta bouche" and loses 1 point on the score track.

At the end of a round, the player with the most points loses the game.

This is the familial variation of the game "Taggle". It's different from the classical version in the sense that the thoughts lines are adapted for the youngest, while "Taggle" is more 'adult' and could not please all parents.

name.value: Rock Stage: A Path to Fame

item.description:
The world's first board game about heavy music, which brought together the experience of the leading concert and promotional agencies.

The player forms a band from the deck of over 100 musician cards. With the band the player attempts to gain as much fame as possible with the money they earn from the band. The player with the most fame at the end of the game wins.

name.value: Krypton Factor Interactive DVD Family Board Game

item.description:
The Krypton Factor Interactive DVD game is a mind-bending fun filled challenging board game the whole family can play.

Use all your powers of Mental Agility, Observation, Intelligence, Physical Agility and General Knowledge to answer questions, solve puzzles and take physical challenges in order to progress around the infamous Krypton assault course.

Gain Stamina tokens on the way to overcome the 13 course obstacles that await you. Will you be the first across the finish line and be able to call yourself the Krypton Factor Champion?

From the back of the box:

Whether it's your first visit to the apple orchard or you've been drinking the cider for years, everyone will find outrageous laughs in the Apples to Apples 15th Appleversary Edition!

It looks a little fancier - all dressed up in black and gold, with updated content to keep things fresh - but it's still the same classic game play that's sold more than 15 million copies! Just play a Black Apple card from your hand that best matches the White Apple card. If the judge picks your card, you win the round!

Packed with exclusive Appleversary scoring tokens and bushels of cards never before seen in a Party Box, the Apples to Apples 15th Appleversary Edition proves that some things just get better with age!

item.description:
Abstract game where players will build the dungeon rooms with cards from their hands until reaching the exit of the dungeon. Players will earn victory points matching cards played with position of their pawns.

The goal is to arrive to the exit but be sure to have enough points to win.

link.value: Duelo Primigenio: The Rainbow Shoushiling Cards Project

item.description: I Love Portugal is a simple deck-building game in which players take the rôle of tourists and travel along Portugal, visiting unique monuments and breathtaking landscapes. Take the best pictures, share your albums and imagine the perfect selfie. Are you ready for the adventure ? Take your backpack and go discover Portugal.

name.value: Dungeon Storming: Il Nido di Phirion

item.description:
From the back of the box:

"Alone, in the depths of the dungeon, surrounded by monsters. A Barbar and a Ranger against a host of fierce Draconians. Rich treasures await you, with which you can get new weapons, armor, spells and scrolls. Will you become so powerful to face the Dragon Phitrion and become heroes?"

A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with more players by combining two or more sets of Dungeon Storming!"

The game is played by moving the miniatures of your heroes on the map, room by room, battling the monsters with a simple roll of a die, dodging the traps, collecting treasures and magic objects, until the heroes reach the last room and try to overcome the boss monster (the heroes can exit the dungeon and buy new objects with the money found).

The map and the layout of the rooms for this dungeon are fixed (all the tables for the encounters, treasures and magical objects are printed on it), but it can be played with four levels of difficulty.

link.value: Dungeon Storming: La Cripta di Razidar
Dungeon Storming: La Tana di Gwarl
Dungeon Storming: La Torre di Kunrat

item.description:
The find and hide game of chickens and eggs!

Cluck! Cluck! What an “egg-cellent” memory you have!

A “My First Game” for your clever little farmer. With constant motion, Peek-A-Doodle Doo engages your child's memory and concentration in a farm fresh way!

Fast-moving fun; game pieces are in constant motion!

First, use memory to collect all 12 eggs and return them to the crate. Then, use memory to cover all 12 eggs by chickens
Free range chickens feature fun rubbery beaks, combs and tails
Components of silicone rubber, plastic, reinforced printed cardboard.

Sporttable Box is a fusion between boardgames and Physical Activity.

On the board, you have the possibility of playing three different games: pursuit race, tug of war, and team sports. The gameplay is much alike that of party-games: the rules are easy to follow but, in order for you or your team to make strategic progress on the board, the players need to perform some active challenges (physical challenges with different levels of difficulty, by the way). These were carefully designed to create fun moments of challenge either against a goal, the timer or the opponent team.

There are more than 60 challenges divided into 4 categories: strength, dexterity, speed and mime (this one also provides a funny moment as it is about sports). So... roll the die, pick a card and let's get started! We are... SPORTACULAR!

item.description: Spin the spinner and fill the floating space station with cosmic cargo - but watch out! The Stellosphere is barely balanced and a lopsided load will send it crashing to Earth in a nanosecond and you must collect anything that has fallen off! Use your dexterity skills and superstellar strategy to win by stacking all your pieces on the space station before anyone else!

Radar Command is a 90-120 minute strategy board game. Start by building your own fleet, choosing from ships, islands, a radar base, air fields and etc... Once your fleet has been picked place your pieces on your map.

Once your pieces are in play it's time to search and destroy your opponent. May the best admiral win!

By using special interrupter cards you can add reinforcements, repair damage or retreat from a particularly intense battle.

With Radar Command's unique playing boards you can write directly on the playing board and easily erase for the next game. Have fun each game by choosing different ships and bases and by varying your game board set-up.

Publisher's description: In this exciting dice game, you go on a thrilling journey through Arendelle and make your way to Elsa's Ice Palace with all your favorite Frozen characters! With a little strategy and luck of the dice you will be the first player to reach the Ice Palace and win the game!

name.value: Trivial Pursuit: Family Edition Featuring the Magic of Disney

item.description: Trivial Pursuit Featuring the Magic of Disney Family Edition Master Game from Parker Brothers and Horn Abbott. Game includes two sets of questions (one for kids and one for adults). This is a complete boxed set including the cards and a Disney themed board.

BetaBotz is a fun and competitive multiplayer board game where players bid on robots, upgrade their robot with components and execute powerful codes to accomplish tiered missions. Each mission provides the players a currency reward giving them more bidding power and bringing them closer to victory. Robots will need to work with and against one another to become the ultimate BetaBot worthy of entering Robotopia.

BetaBotz takes minimal time to learn but includes enough variation in content and strategy that no two games are the same. The simultaneous mission feature of BetaBotz allows all players to participate during missions. There is a high level of engagement and interaction between the players so that everyone can have a blast through the entirety of game play!

Players start BetaBotz with 40 bitz (currency) and use this starting pool to bid on a robot body with stats in four attributes (Agility, Firepower, Structure and Processor). Throughout the game players use their remaining bitz and any bit rewards received to bid against one another on components that increase their attributes or select single use "Code Cards" in an effort to complete missions. In addition to components increasing a robot's ability to complete missions, achieving a stat of 13 or more in an attribute activates a power associated with that attribute.

A complete game of BetaBotz is played over the course of ten missions. Mission cards of different tiers are selected based on the number of players. Missions require at least a specific value in one (or multiple) of the four attributes to complete. All players attempt to complete the current mission simultaneously and those that are successful receive a reward of bitz. Players are able to form teams to complete the current mission but they must split the mission rewards among the team. At the conclusion of the 10th mission the player with the highest individual attribute, the most gold components and code cards each receive an additional bitz reward. The player with the most bitz at the end of the game, including the bonus bitz, is the winner.

item.description:
These adorable animals will steal your heart in this crazy card drafting and dice stealing game. You will have to think on your feet to make the most of the animal cards you are given.

Overview
Each player chooses an animal to play. The cards are dealt and dice are rolled. Then players draft cards each turn and place their dice to try to get the highest score. Each card has two possible effects depending on which player drafts the card. To win the game, players will have to choose the best combos of dice and cards. After 5 rounds the hand is done and players add up their scores. See the tutorial link for more information.

Inverted Dice is a challenging tactic dice game for smart adults and curious children. The game introduces a new way to look at dice rolls – a way to regard five normal six-sided dice as one big twenty-sided die (with some odd probability properties). Normally, you would throw some dice and calculate the sum of the numbers being shown. In this game, you calculate the sum of the numbers NOT being shown. Such a roll is called an inverted dice roll and is made with standard six-sided dice. You need five dice to play.
 The structure of the game is a bit like the one in Yahtzee, with a similar score chart and three rolls (or fewer) per turn.
 There are twenty rounds in the game. In each round, players take turns rolling five dice (inverted), trying to reach one of the numbers from 1 to 20 (it has to be a number that the player has not previously achieved or zeroed out).
 After each inverted dice roll, the player chooses which dice to keep, and which to reroll. A player may reroll some or all of the dice up to two times on a turn, making a maximum of three rolls each turn.
 If a player achieves an available result, it is registered in the score chart.
 If the player fails (after three rolls), a number must be recorded as zero points.
 Every player must put either a score or a zero into a score box each turn.
 The game ends when all score boxes are used. The player with the highest total score wins the game.

Players can receive maximum three bonuses by achieving all scores in one or more bonus sections.

item.description:
From the publisher:

Hexlinx is an intriguing game of geometric strategy in which players start each turn with 6 tiles, then score points by trading, switching, and connecting them to build a honeycomb grid of interlocked rings. Each ring must include 6 different color tiles. When all the tiles have been drawn and no player can form any more rings, the game is over. Highest score wins. 
 Uniquely simple yet challenging, this exciting game of logic requires strategic planning (and a little luck) to win. For a variety of gameplay, some optional Rules can be used -- and because there are 2 methods of scoring points (standard and advanced), Hexlinx is FUN for children and adults of all skill levels !
Players race to spell words combining the consonant cards in their hand with the vowel dice in the Dice Slide. The first to state their word wins the hand.

Busted is a push-your-luck dice game played with eight dice. After each throw, one or more dice must be "locked" and the player can then choose whether to roll again or to bank any accumulated points. However, if a player eventually spells out “B-U-S-T-E-D“ on the dice, they lose any accumulated points for that hand. Players roll the dice for as long as they can to drive up their score toward the goal of 1000 points.

Travel to the past with Jonon and Jada, two stone age children, to rediscover how the first humans settled the world around them.

In My First Stone Age, a children's version of the Stone Age family game, the players collect goods and build their own settlement.

link.value: My First Stone Age: The Card Game

item.description:
Compete with your family or friends to see who has the biggest musical culture of yesterday and today.

Nostalgia and laughter guaranteed ! Young and old have their chance with nearly 1600 questions. Answer the questions of the cards and try to recognize visual album covers, complete an unforgettable words or recognize who owns accessories from famous ...

And without realizing it, you will sing on tubes that have marked you.

2-6 players or teams of players.

Players are sentient dice that are evolving and battling at the same time.

Dice Mutants: Evolution Battle is a dice drafting game. At the beginning of a round, all the dice in the game are rolled and then players take turns claiming one of the available dice. The dice players draft are then assigned to improve their attack, defense, guile, mutation, and speed.

Every round, each Dice Mutant attacks every other Dice Mutant. Once a player has lost all their life points, they are out of the game. Last player left alive is the winner.

Game Background:

You are the leader of a village in the forest of Na~TACE. Your expansion views require resources and pushes you to explore the surrounding areas.

Your lumberer will quickly discover areas for the development of agriculture for your farmers or mining for your blacksmith.

The wood harvested and will allow you to build farms, forges, fences or barracks for your soldiers.

But will your farmers and your hunter be able to provide enough food for your soldiers? No problem, send your merchant to other villages to share valuable resources.

Many other surprises await you in this game of resources gathering, war and colonization.

Finally, attack enemy villages to colonize the entire forest and win the game!

How to play:

The goal of the game is to eliminated other players by destroying their village with your soldiers.

24, 36 or 48 hexa cards (forests) are placed in a predetermined shape according to the number of players.
Each player choose a village and pick 3 ressources card.

Player 1 will advance his lumberer pawn forest by forest and discover 3 areas by flipping the forests he passes on. Underneath, he may discover a regular forest, a farm land, a mind land or a special land.

The lumberer will pick 3 wood cards and will use them to build farms (placing a pawn on the farm land), mines (placing a pawn on the mine land) or barracks (placing a pawn on the village).

For each farmer, the player will pick 1 farm card per farm land with a farmer. The food will be use to feed the soldiers (1 per barrack). Soldier pawns will be moved and advance to eventually attack the other villages or soldiers.

When a soldier or a group of soldiers attack, a D6 is used + all bonus cards the attacker player may have collect. Defense is fixed by the number of soldiers or what type of building is attacked + any defensive bonus the defendant player may have gathered.

Invasion 1066: Stamford Bridge is the second game in the Invasion 1066 series designed by Norm Smith. Originally published as Orri's Storm by Saxon Games, we have enhanced this great design by developing the rule set even further and providing new artwork by industry veteran Charles Kibler.

Just days after defeating an English army at Gate Fulford, Harald Hardrada, the Viking warrior king is caught by surprise at Stamford Bridge by a second English army.

Map scale is 50 meters per hex and the units vary in size from 100 to 250 men. The game is quick-playing and bloody with easy to understand mechanics. Historical touches such as berserker rage, Orri's storm, viking shield wall, army morale by troop type, leader loss, and arrow supply; it is all here in a very easy to play package.

item.description:
From the box cover: "Collect the eggs - but watch out for the crazy dino!"

From the publisher's web site:
"A fantastic educational game from the multi-award winning Chimp and Zee range of games and puzzles. Each player races to collect Dinosaur eggs from the Dino's den on the rock, whilst trying to avoid the tail of the revolving dinosaur; which can knock all the eggs away. The player who has collected the most eggs wins the game. If there is a tie - the player with the most brown eggs wins.

Dodge the Dino is great fun for children and easy for parents to explain. The game can help your child learn through play. Easy to set up you can start playing in just a few minutes and everyone has a chance to win. Only takes ten minutes to play and is even great fun when it's not your turn. Dodge the Dino was created to help children with colours, shapes, matching, and co-ordination along with developing the ability to play together. The game is presented in a quality cardboard carton complete with carry-handle and glitter printing."

item.description:
In the late Middle Ages, the Canary Islands had faded into obscurity from a European point of view. There was neither gold nor silver, and the islands did not play a role as a trading post because the north-south trade of that time went through the Sahara.

In 1312, the Genoese merchant and seafarer Lancelotto Malocello effectively "rediscovered" the Canary Islands. During the 15th century, the archipelago was conquered by the Spanish. Spanish masters pushed agriculture, cultivating sugar cane, wine and grain, which quickly gave the islands a certain economic value and importance.

In West of Africa, the players cultivate goods, try to sell them profitably, and build settlements. Each player has their own deck of cards. Each turn the players select cards from their decks to conduct successful actions, always keeping the actions of the other players in mind.

item.description:
Carrot supplies are getting low and the rabbits must brave the wilds to collect enough to feed the colony! Time is short, the pathways long and the birds are circling overhead, looking for easy prey.

Carrotia is a light co-operative, tile placement game for 1-6 players where the team collectively works together against a timer to build three different mazes of increasing size. The master rabbit needs to dash from entrance to the exit within a specific number of moves according to the current mission card, scooping up the precious carrots while avoiding the owl, hawk and other birds as they swoop low over the zones causing mayhem and mischief.

Although the task may seem daunting, the master rabbit has some supporters, other rabbits that bring a unique special ability to assist the team and and thwart the hungry predators!

item.description:
It is time to polish your armor and sharpen your sword, for mighty Caesar has called for his legions to assemble.

The Cohort is a fast-paced card game for 2-6 players in a race to be the first to assemble a Legion and show Caesar you are the greatest of his commanders.

Legions are composed of 3 different Cohorts, each made of one of seven different types of units: Praetorians, Catapults, Centurions, Sagittarii, Equites, Legionaries and Velites. During a turn, you draw two cards, keep one and give the other to a player of your choice. You can keep that card in your hand or trigger it and create a Cohort. Be careful though, for the troops are rowdy! Until a Cohort is complete their behaviour works against you.

So snap them into line as quickly as you can, disrupt the plans of your fellow commanders and show Caesar that your Legion is the greatest in all the Empire.

item.description:
Excellent fun and educational game of chance for young kids, equally fun for adults. A witch has turned the players into frogs and they must race through her lair to find a cure (cure is a cauldron spinner which will either leave you as a frog or transform you back to human form).

The movement mechanic is where this game shines. 54 cardboard tiles (6 ghosts, 6 spiders, 42 footsteps with 1, 2 or 3 steps each) are used as a movement pool. To move players can turn over as many cards as they wish but try to avoid the ghosts and spiders. Players movement is equal to the number of footsteps they turn over. If they flip a ghost they must move backwards. Spiders stop you in your tracks.

item.description:
The realm is strife with conflict as armies of Humans and Dwarves battle against the swarms of Goblins and Undead. The Barbarian Horde, a neutral 5th army may also enter the fray to fight for either side.

Player's will build large armies, multiple cities, and infrastructure which will help boost their economy and fuel their war machine. Also, each army has four heroes that can be used to explore dungeons, fight monsters, gain valuable treasure and ultimately advance levels in an attempt to lead their armies to victory. Each faction has unique units, spells, heroes, and upgrades at their disposal. It is only through the careful balance of limited resources that can win the day. There are many paths to victory. The struggle is real. The carnage is devastating. The conquest has begun!

Conquest and Carnage are the next in the line of the Warparty series. Lock'n Load Publishing will not be publishing this game. You can find the first game Warparty series at the link below.

https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/94255/warparty

To bring the best youngsters into the business, the smuggler boss is holding a contest, with the candidates being challenged to move a sack filled with contraband through an opening in the fence.

More specifically, in Smugglers players form the "sacks" used for smuggling out of modeling clay and hide their contraband within. The sacks are then rolled down a 3D path, with a die roll determining which hole in the fence the player needs to try to squeeze through. The player whose bag fits through the hole and who has the largest sack now checks the smaller bags, possibly taking the contraband hidden within. Who will prove to be the best smuggler?

item.description:
Outlive is a management/survival game in a post-apocalyptic universe in which nature has overcome its rights amongst the world of Men. In Outlive, players have six days (turns) to send heroes gathering resources during the day, while avoiding threats from other players and reinforce their settlements during the night, trying to recruit new survivors and adapt to the new world. The specifics: movements and resource gathering are compelled by your hero's strength.

You play six rounds (six days) that are divided between the day phase and the night phase. During the day phase, you move your four heroes of different strength on the board to collect resources with a mechanical movement innovative and interactive.

During the night phase, you manage your shelter, feed your survivors and recruit new ones, organize your survival, and improve your rooms and objects.

Only one clan can outlive this devastated world!

item.description:
The dice dance across the table in Zock 'n' Roll, and every player must ask themselves: Should I get out and be satisfied with a little success, or do I stick with it even though I might end up empty-handed?

A good poker face is required because every player keeps three dice hidden for themselves, and they get to add the result of those dice to what's thrown face-up for all to see, thereby adding additional uncertainty and stress. If you can pinch players in the early rounds, whoever stays in the longest can skim off the cream for themselves...

item.description:
Memory game played with dice.
Studied to be able to help the Alzheimer patients.

Content :
1 game board -9 coloured cubes -2 dice -54 coloured pegs (6 of each colour).

Object of the game :
Memorize the placement of nine coloured cubes, and after turning them face down, retrieve them. The winner is the first to get 6 coloured pegs in his scoring row.

Beginning of the game :
Place the nine cubes colour side up. You have one minutes to memorize each one’s location before turning them face down. The youngest player starts by rolling both dice, then play continue clockwise.

Rules of play :
The white die indicates the colour the player has to find, if it shows a star the player may choose the colour to find. He then turn over one of the cubes.

-If it is the right colour, the player puts one peg of the same colour in his scoring row, he then put back the cube but switching its location with another cube and without looking at the colour of the other cube. Then he gives the dice to the player to his left.

-If its not the right colour, he simply put the cube back in place and gives the dices to the player to his left.

Play continue until one plyer has filled the six spaces in his score row.

The black die :
If ithe black die shows a star and the white die shows a colour, all players may look for the corresponding cube. The fastest player to put his finger on a cube then turn it face up, if it is the right colour, he wins a coloured peg and play continues as normal. If it is not the right colour he loses a peg of that colour if he has one in his score raw, and play resumes as normal.

If a player wins a peg of a colour that is no longer available he may steal if from one of the other players scoring row.


 The black die is not recommended when playing with children under the age of 7.
